column4: How hard is it to get an Ubuntu install to make /home on /dev/hdb1 ?
trivial.
In the installer, choose advanced partitioning, create the raid1 in the installer, format and mount it (or just format and mount, if it's hardware (promise/highpoint is NOT hardware, do not use))
no it's a Dell PowerEdge
Then it ought to just pick up the array. In the aprtition setup, choose hdb1 and tell the system to mount it on /home

Then you probably have a dell poweredge ;-)
